<title>The Legendary 1979 No Nukes Concerts | Bruce Springsteen</title>
<meta name="description" content="The Legendary 1979 No Nukes Concerts from Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band feature Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band's entire thirteen-song setlist from the September 1979 MUSE (Musicians United for Safe Energy) benefit concerts at Madison Square Garden in New York City." />
<meta name="robots" content="index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1" />
<link rel="canonical" href="https://brucespringsteen.net/albums/the-legendary-1979-no-nukes-concerts/" />
<meta property="og:locale" content="en_US" />
<meta property="og:type" content="article" />
<meta property="og:title" content="The Legendary 1979 No Nukes Concerts" />
<meta property="og:description" content="The Legendary 1979 No Nukes Concerts from Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band feature Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band's entire thirteen-song setlist from the September 1979 MUSE (Musicians United for Safe Energy) benefit concerts at Madison Square Garden in New York City. The concert includes footage of ten never-before-released performances from within its crackling 90 minutes. Edited from the original 16mm film by longtime Springsteen collaborator Thom Zimny alongside remixed audio from Bob Clearmountain, "No Nukes" marks the highest quality and best recorded Springsteen performances from an explosive, ascendant and rarely-filmed era of the E Street Band." />
<meta property="og:url" content="https://brucespringsteen.net/albums/the-legendary-1979-no-nukes-concerts/" />

<meta name="twitter:description" content="The Legendary 1979 No Nukes Concerts from Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band feature Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band's entire thirteen-song setlist from the September 1979 MUSE (Musicians United for Safe Energy) benefit concerts at Madison Square Garden in New York City. The concert includes footage of ten never-before-released performances from within its crackling 90 minutes. Edited from the original 16mm film by longtime Springsteen collaborator Thom Zimny alongside remixed audio from Bob Clearmountain, "No Nukes" marks the highest quality and best recorded Springsteen performances from an explosive, ascendant and rarely-filmed era of the E Street Band." />

yoast_head_json.title: The Legendary 1979 No Nukes Concerts | Bruce Springsteen
yoast_head_json.description: The Legendary 1979 No Nukes Concerts from Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band feature Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band's entire thirteen-song setlist from the September 1979 MUSE (Musicians United for Safe Energy) benefit concerts at Madison Square Garden in New York City.
yoast_head_json.og_description: The Legendary 1979 No Nukes Concerts from Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band feature Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band's entire thirteen-song setlist from the September 1979 MUSE (Musicians United for Safe Energy) benefit concerts at Madison Square Garden in New York City. The concert includes footage of ten never-before-released performances from within its crackling 90 minutes. Edited from the original 16mm film by longtime Springsteen collaborator Thom Zimny alongside remixed audio from Bob Clearmountain, "No Nukes" marks the highest quality and best recorded Springsteen performances from an explosive, ascendant and rarely-filmed era of the E Street Band.
yoast_head_json.twitter_description: The Legendary 1979 No Nukes Concerts from Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band feature Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band's entire thirteen-song setlist from the September 1979 MUSE (Musicians United for Safe Energy) benefit concerts at Madison Square Garden in New York City. The concert includes footage of ten never-before-released performances from within its crackling 90 minutes. Edited from the original 16mm film by longtime Springsteen collaborator Thom Zimny alongside remixed audio from Bob Clearmountain, "No Nukes" marks the highest quality and best recorded Springsteen performances from an explosive, ascendant and rarely-filmed era of the E Street Band.
